results.title: Urban landscape
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Exploring Photography”.
One of a series aimed to improve the viewers’ understanding of urban landscape photography as a creative medium and to increase their awareness of visual options. Several photographers discuss their aims and show their work. Narrated by Bryn Campbell.
results.description:

results.title: Landscape
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Exploring Photography”.
Deals with a wide variety of approaches to landscape photography, including the adventurous work of Ernst Haas and the more symbolic black and white of John Blakemore. Presented by Bryn Campbell.

results.title: The Portrait
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Exploring Photography”.
Aims to improve the viewers’ understanding of portrait photography as a creative medium and to increase their awareness of the visual options available to them as photographers. Several still photographers discuss their work.

results.title: Movement
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Exploring Photography”.
One of a series aimed to improve the viewer’s awareness of movement in photography as a creative medium and to increase their understanding of visual options. Several photographers discuss their techniques and show pictures of their style, including Ernst Haas, famous for his highly original colour photographs.

results.title: Painting time
results.creator_credit: David Vogt, John Friedman and Education Development Center Film Studio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Follows a young child totally absorbed in exploration of line, color and shape. Highlights gross motor skills and the concentration span of the four to five year old child. Suitable for teacher/tertiary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Vogt, John Friedman and Education Development Center Film Studio

results.title: Little blocks
results.creator_credit: John Friedman and Education Development Center Film Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Portrays an adolescent working with preschoolers. However the adolescent dominates all play activities until the child becomes disinterested. Shows the nonverbal clues given by the child which are ignored by the adolescent.

results.title: From my point of view
results.creator_credit: John Friedman and Education Development Center
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Uses sequences showing children from the ages of two and a half to five and a half with an adult in order to analyse the ways in which a child’s egocentrism affects the ability to see another person’s point of view. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
